titleStmt.title: Estes Davis to James W. Tate
CWG8055

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Cincinnati July 30th 1863
His Excellency
The Governor of Kentuckey

Dr Sir as a commissioner of Deeds &c for the State of Kentuckey is needed here I take this liberty of applying to your Excellency for a commission to do that business under protection of Our City Auditor &c whose cerdential I herewith Enclose with my signature thereon as Matter of convenient reference for you to keep I also herewith enclose the fee of Five Dollars as required by law and if these preliminaries are Satisfactory I Shall await receipt of your Valued favor & the necessary commission

With High Consideration I remain Dr Sir
Yours Very Truly Estes Davis
No 35 West 3d St

This Letter is Directed to Care of Hon Jas W Tate
Asst Secretary of State
Frankfort Ky --

Ohio
Estes Davis
Comr of Deeds
Cincinnati
Com. Issd Aug. 4th 1863.
